1144345.markdown:
So, I know what you are thinking: "A Miracle Rogue with no sense cards like [
Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) and [ Myra's Unstable Element
](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) ? You are crazy!"

Let me introduce you to  the new best _ "fantacombo" _ of the century  !

_ Before start leave an upvote on this deck for more strange combo decks! _

** Cards needed for the combo: **

  *     * [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) : it's the core card: without this the combo won't work. 
    * [ Myra's Unstable Element ](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) : it's an important card that helps you to clear your deck. 
    * 1x [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) : it's an important piece of the combo because it will kill [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) . 
    * 2x [ Shadowstep ](/cards/550-shadowstep) : they are the cards that allows you to get cheaper [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) and [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) . 
    * 1x [ Backstab ](/cards/471-backstab) : it allows you to kill [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll)

** How the combo works: **

Be sure to have [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) , [ Voodoo Doll
](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) , 2x [ Shadowstep ](/cards/550-shadowstep) , [
Myra's Unstable Element ](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) and 1x [
Backstab ](/cards/471-backstab) in your hand.

  1. Use [ Myra's Unstable Element ](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) to get an empty deck and play every card drawn 
  2. Play [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) and return this to your hand with [ Shadowstep ](/cards/550-shadowstep)
  3. Play [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) and return this to your hand with [ Shadowstep ](/cards/550-shadowstep)
  4. When your board, deck,  and hand are empty of not combo cards, play [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) and target him with [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) . 
  5. Kill [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) with [ Backstab ](/cards/471-backstab) and win! :D 

** Tips: **

  *     * You can replace the rest of the deck with other cards, but i think that a miracle Rogue [a Rogue that draws so many times] is the best choice. 
    * Do the combo in the explained order, because if you use [ Myra's Unstable Element ](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) with a not full/semi-full hand you are forced to play many other cards. 
    * You aren't forced to win with the combo: you can use also combo cards for a tempo play especially versus an aggro deck. 

** Fan's combo ideas: **

** As I repeated many times, _ [ Assassinate ](/cards/568-assassinate) WON'T kill one of your minion!  _ **

** [ Rvo2099 ](https://www.hearthpwn.com/members/Rvo2099) : **

  1. Use [ Myra's Unstable Element ](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) with the same combo pieces in your hand. 
  2. Use [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) and [ Shadowstep ](/cards/550-shadowstep) it. 
  3. Play [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) and use a [ The Coin ](/cards/141-the-coin) [gained with [ WANTED! ](/cards/89363-wanted) ] 
  4. Play [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) , [ Backstab ](/cards/471-backstab) it and win! :D 

** [ Vitya_Pinguinus ](https://www.hearthpwn.com/members/Vitya_Pinguinus) : **

  1. Use [ Myra's Unstable Element ](/cards/89802-myras-unstable-element) with the same combo pieces in your hand. 
  2. Use [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) and [ Shadowstep ](/cards/550-shadowstep) it. 
  3. Play [ Galvanizer ](/cards/89891-galvanizer) [on [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) ] 
  4. Play [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) and [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) it. 
  5. [ Backstab ](/cards/471-backstab) [ Voodoo Doll ](/cards/89404-voodoo-doll) and win! :D 

** Edits: **

  * Removed 2x [ Fal'dorei Strider ](/cards/76914-faldorei-strider) and added 2x [ Hench-Clan Thug ](/cards/89456-hench-clan-thug)

_ ** I hope so much that you enjoyed this deck, leave an upvote and share this
strange deck with your friends! ** _ ** :D **

1145812.author: YourPrivateNightmare
1145812.markdown:
So after seeing both [ Galvanizer ](/cards/89891-galvanizer) and [ Mecha'thun
](/cards/89877-mechathun) I quickly realized (as did many others) the immense
potential of a Warlock Mecha'thun deck. Aditionally, all the combo pieces
happen to be even costed and your aim is to get rid of your deck quickly,
which makes for osme very convenient [ Genn Greymane ](/cards/89336-genn-
greymane) shenanigans.

The combo is as obvious as it is simple. Once you have Mecha'thun in hand you
play both Galvanizers to mkae him cost 8. then you simply draw your entire
deck (easily, thanks to 1-cost Hero power) and you'll only need 10-mana and
more than 4 health to pull it off.

Mecha'thun + Bloodbloom + Cataclysm. Your hand is discarded, your board
destroyed, and your deck already gone. There is no reasonable way (outside of
[ Counterspell ](/cards/531-counterspell) or a lucky [ Demonic Project
](/cards/89825-demonic-project) ) to stop this combo. It's Exodia in its
purest form.

Now, an addition that I didn't see anyone considering is [ Keening Banshee
](/cards/62954-keening-banshee) After getting all your combo pieces in hand
you can easily just play Banshee into both Galvanizers (+ any other 2-drop)
and burn the rest of your deck fairly quickly, while immediately setting up to
win on the next turn.

Out of all the possible ways to get Mecha'thun to work, this seems the most
consistent, especially considering that it's probably faster than most other
OTK decks that may or may not pop up. Even Warlock has already proven itself
as a powerful deck that can outtempo control decks and control aggro decks.
This deck just swaps tempo for complete annihilation (which is probably a lot
more effective I'd say)

This list isn't optimized by any means, I just threw in as many stall cards as
I possibly could to maximize the potential against aggro since no control
deck, not even Shudderwock can actually beat this, given you optimize draw and
removal.

They might actually have to nerf this. It just feels wrong.

** Updates: **

Update 1: Removed one Banshee and added another Curse of Weakness. Banshee is
supposed to only help you rush your combo against other combo decks. Curse of
weakness can be huge against board-heavy aggro decks and stall until you get
healing or boardclears (and help Doomsayer stick)

Update 2: ** We made it to the frontpage boys, thanks for all the upvotes. I
will craft the deck immediately at release, play it excessively and keep
updating it if it proves to be any kind of viable. **

Update 3: after testing the deck in the current meta (since the only cards
from the new expansion are combo pieces). It's very hard to survive against
aggro decks. even with the large amount of board clears available (tapping
really does hurt the face after a while). I'm beginning to consider if maybe a
more control oriented build with Voidlords might be better, although it would
severly hurt it's potential against other combo decks since you don't draw
nearly as fast

Update 4: "Won" two games. One against Big Spell Mage, and one against Taunt
Druid. Curse of Weakness proved to be exceptionally useful as a stalling tool.
Keening Banshee didn't see any use since both times the last combo piece was
at the bottom of the deck. this proves, however, that the win condition can
work quite easily against any other slow deck, even if you can't turbo the
combo.

Update 5: "Won" another game. This time against Odd Elemental Mage (not a
particularly strong deck, I know). This time Keening Banshee was actually
relevant, even if only for 3 cards (which stil accelerated the combo by 3
turns). I'm starting to think more and more that a [ Voidlord
](/cards/76913-voidlord) \+ [ Possessed Lackey ](/cards/76948-possessed-
lackey) style deck would be better versus aggro. Banshee works well enough as
a last minute card dump that the upgraded Hero Power isn't absolutely
necessary. I was also thinking about [ Witchwood Piper ](/cards/89427
-witchwood-piper) to fetch combo pieces earlier, but in the Even version there
are too many 2-drops while in the Voidlord version it would conflict with
Lackey, since Piper is a demon now (probably the only time ever that
consistency change mattered).

1146532.author: Schnez01
1146532.markdown:
Just a cheeky bit of theorycrafting with Mecha'Thun, using Even Warlock as a
base. I will be testing this deck day 1 of the expansion, and will also post a
Mulligan guide if this can get +20 up-votes. Note that this deck list is
likely to change before 'The Boomsday Project' is released.

** In case you missed it, combo is as follows: **

  1. Empty your deck (easy to do with 1 mana hero power) 
  2. Play 2x [ Galvanizer ](/cards/89891-galvanizer) with [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun) in hand (cost will be reduced to 8 mana) 
  3. Play [ Mecha'thun ](/cards/89877-mechathun)
  4. Play [ Bloodbloom ](/cards/55594-bloodbloom) and [ Cataclysm ](/cards/76918-cataclysm) . 
  5. Bam you win! 

** Edit: ** I decided to replace 2x [ Loot Hoarder ](/cards/395-loot-hoarder) with 2x [ Plated Beetle ](/cards/76995-plated-beetle) for better early game. 

_ ** I ** _ _ ** f you like the deck please up-vote ** _

>

> I've painstakingly omitted [ Deathstalker Rexxar ](/cards/58724
-deathstalker-rexxar) as I think this deck is more on the aggro side. If it's
struggling late game he's the first port of call for inclusion.

>

> I've also omitted [ Terrorscale Stalker ](/cards/55505-terrorscale-stalker)
, [ Play Dead ](/cards/62891-play-dead) and [ Carnivorous Cube ](/cards/73325
-carnivorous-cube) , as the deathrattle value isn't great for the sake of
dealing 2 extra damage face. I think building and controlling board around the
threat of the [ Goblin Bomb ](/cards/89850-goblin-bomb) 's is enough. Going
BIG on Deathrattle would require inclusion of bigger Deaththrattle threats
like [ Mechanical Whelp ](/cards/89852-mechanical-whelp) .

>

> I also considered [ Goblin Prank ](/cards/89937-goblin-prank) for a while
but I think that fits better in the afformentioned BIG Deathrattle focussed
version of the deck with cube’s, stalkers, play dead’s & big minions. I’ve
tried to make this version board-control heavy where you want your goblin
bombs to ‘stick’ a bit more to the board, where the 2 damage to the face is a
punishment for clearing them. In that respect triggering our deathrattles is
fine but we don’t want the [ Goblin Bomb ](/cards/89850-goblin-bomb) 's to die
unnecessarily as we lose Magnetic/Mech synergy potential.

>

> In the same respect; I felt [ Void Ripper
](https://www.hearthpwn.com/cards/76973-void-ripper) would be a frustrating
top deck or mulligan in this deck, when it's really an end game OTK better
suited into the above mentioned BIG Deathrattle cube variant. Our [ Goblin
Bomb ](/cards/89850-goblin-bomb) Deathrattles will still ultimately get
triggered if we want, when we bolt any of our Magnetic Mech's onto our bombs,
or when we drop a [ Defender of Argus ](https://www.hearthpwn.com/cards/542
-defender-of-argus) or [ Fungalmancer
](https://www.hearthpwn.com/cards/76991-fungalmancer) down inbetween them for
pushing minions or threatening face damage. The threat of that Deathrattle
damage is still there ... we just hold board control too alongside it. The
same goes for [ Abomination ](/cards/597-abomination) , [ Ticking Abomination
](/cards/61811-ticking-abomination) & [ Mossy Horror ](/cards/89417-mossy-
horror) .
